backlog-item.name: Joystick Add-On Device to move joystick based on User Mental Inputs
backlog-item.description: Study the suitibility and build a device to move the joystick as the user mind desires with the Emotiv device as normalized and sent by the C code.

task.name: Design Device
task.description: Create the joystick add on device. Possible design involved. Preliminary design will be servors moving a control wire and servos on tracks to move in perpendicular direction to servos direction.

task.name: Wire the device to the Arduino (Servos and code)
task.description: Wire the device and the servos to the arduino. There is a holdup the servos will be here on Friday

task.name: Create Device
task.description: Create plywood platform for device. Cut wire and modify for joystick hookup. Weld wire and velcro platform. Strap servos. This is the individual portion. There will be a joint build session at a later date.

task.name: Finish the device
task.description: Take measurements and observations from testing on Monday to complete the joystick build. Needed updated measurements taken on Wed. The device is now finished. It included welding the wire, cutting the plywood, nailing/screwing the plywood together, making brackets for the servos and insuring clearance was had for all parts. Finally, this included painting the device. Before this task time was at around ~4-5 hours. After this time is at ~10 hours. Took longer, but effort was worth it. Device is complete!

task.name: Finalize servo code and test servos.
task.description: This is the act of finalizing the servo code and testing them. Of course more testing will occur with everything put together. But, this is the task of assuring the servos work, and the intendend movement can be attained before installing in the device.

backlog-item.name: C program to Normalize User Inputs and Connect to Arduino - Part 1
backlog-item.description: Finish the C code to communicate with the Arduino and Emotiv as well as normalize input. This includes finishing testing, algorithms, and validation of input.

task.name: Normalization for left (left.c)
task.description: Finish this function and normalize the input. May need some normalization in main switch, or an array for recent previous values.

task.name: Normalization for right (right.c)
task.description: Finish this function and normalize the input. May need some normalization in main switch, or an array for recent previous values.

task.name: Get static analysis tool working with Jenkins
task.description: Static analysis tool works but need it to integrate with Jenkins and print results. Note: having some issues with server being able to run the tests.

task.name: Get Dynamic Analysis Tool Working
task.description: Get a dynamic analysis tool working that is stable on all computers and works on Jenkins. Valgrind needs to be installed on jenkins server. Still evaluting from the suite to make sure it performs testing as needed and wanted.

task.name: Get Unit Test Framework Working
task.description: Get Unit test framework working with Jenkins and on a stable solution for everyone's computers. Results are currently not possible.

task.name: Finalize USBSerialComm.c to connect to Arduino
task.description: Testing was needed and now thats done the Arduino can be connected with. Finalize the connection functions to send data to the Arduino.

task.name: Normalization Finalize
task.description: This is the task for finalizin the normalization. Adding an array of last inputs, figuring out delay, and what response time we need to be looking at. This takes a general approach and somewhat an emotiv specific.

task.name: Normalization Testing and Measurements From Emotiv
task.description: This is the act of measuring emotiv's nuances and response time so that an accurate normalization algorithm can be written. This should while using and on the wheelchair.

task.name: Fix bug cppcheck in build and re-design code for valgrind.
task.description: Fix the cppcheck bug and re-design how the code works for an automatic valgrind test that currently isn't possible.

task.name: User menu
task.description: User menu to select options. These options should be for instructions, setup of input, setup of output, and possibly normalization parameters.

task.name: Refactor of Normalization Code
task.description: This is the refactor of the normalization code into seperate functions and to make the code more maintainable following a code review.

backlog-item.name: C program to Normalize User Inputs and Connect to Arduino
backlog-item.description: This is the finish up of the code that takes the neuro-headset inputs and normalizes them and outputs them to an Arduino, which is connected to a joystick movement device.

task.name: Write Unit Tests
task.description: Write unit tests, simple c framework, will be our own implementation at this time.

task.name: Setup of a logger for black box testing.
task.description: In main menu option available to create log.txt file, movements will append chars to file so we can see what commands are sent. Set up so each log txt creation will overwrite previous and will have timestamp on first line. Need to consider a deletion option or in very initial setup to delete prior log file.

task.name: Add enumeration for baud rates.
task.description: Add enumerator for all the different baud rates so user can select a valid baud rate.

task.name: Linux/Mac Port for USBSerialComm.c
task.description: Port UsbSerialComm.c to use linux/unix POSIX commands so that it can be built and tested similar to the Windows version. This will hopefully be used for Linux/Mac users of emotiv's free software.

task.name: Input function for User Menu Selection
task.description: This is the creation of a function for user menu selection. We rushed an earlier version with poor reliablity and security. This input function should make the code more reliable and user friendly

task.name: Code Review Admin and Summary
task.description: This is the act of performing code reviews on code to ensure user safety and focus on reliabilty for thie project.

task.name: Save and load file.
task.description: This is the user functionality to save and load a configuration file. This will reduce time and rework on subsequent startups.

task.name: Fix build and re-structure code for new functionality.
task.description: This fixed the build at the current time. Re-structored some code for readibility, maintainability and to address some smells. Tested and made sure functionality works and cleaned up anything else found as well as fixed bugs based on compiler and static tools.

task.name: Save and Load file Polish Up.
task.description: This is the task of finishing and testing the save and load file and making it user friendly

task.name: Finish up advanced dynamic testing.
task.description: This is adding on to the current dynamic testing to help the tool go through more of the code to ensure easily findable defects are found.

task.name: Finish Unit Tests Assigned and Assign Tests for Rest of the team.
task.description: Team splits up unit tests so all can learn and have practice. Have looked at this before, but this will be the concrete realization and a visible proof that code has been tested. This is the task of assigining tests to the rest of the team and analyzing coverage as well as finishing the assigned unit tests.

backlog-item.name: Joystick Movement Device to convey inputs into joystick movements. (Bug: Servos and wiring)
backlog-item.description: This is the backlog item for a bug we are experiencing. Due to the Arduino's small screw holes, smaller screws were needed to be purchased. As such we couldn't mount the board in a timely matter. When we mounted the board we had to redo the wiring, which when rewired caused the servos not to function properly. This item is the act of fixing that bug and routing the wire in safe and pleasant manner, as well as hooking up the forward back servo since it came dislodged from its mounting bracket.

task.name: Tin wiring and re-organize wires.
task.description: Worked with Darryl and found that side servo does not function properly at all and seems like needs replacement, identified that forward/back servo needed an initilaztion degree to fix weird problem. Need to tin wiring to get rid of frayed wires

task.name: Bug: Fix wiring and figure out why servos are acting inconsistent.
task.description: Everything was working after a weekend of testing. When the arduino board and the wiring was diassembled for attachment to the device (due to smaller machine screws being needed), and then re-assembled it did not work in the same manner. Most likely this is a ground issue, but it could be inconsistencies with the servos. This is high priority, and will become a spike if not fixed soon!

backlog-item.name: Arduino and code to move the wheelchair based on user inputs from the C program.
backlog-item.description: This is the act of going over the code once more in reviews and /or refactoring and a consensus that this meets to the goals for a safety critical system. Also, testing if possible, and any new features that are to be added at request of sponsor which are none at this time.

task.name: Test Ack for showing that Arduino is indeed connected on named Serial Port
task.description: This is the task of setting up an Ack as it were to respond back to the computer program to make sure the Arduino is connected.

task.name: Test Arduino code and Polish up Any Lingering Issues.
task.description: This is the act of testing the Arduino code with the Arduino, Joystick Device (like usual), but also adding the program and emotiv into the mix and polishing any rough spots that may appear in the Arduino states or issues with the Arduino not being in the correct state at the correct time.

backlog-item.name: Linux and Mac functionality - NICE TO HAVE
backlog-item.description: The framework is there, but several functions have to be completed to allow users of Mac and Linux operating systems to connect with the externan wheelchair controller.

backlog-item.name: Continuous Feedback and/or Operation - NEXT RELEASE
backlog-item.description: This is the act of the user being able to have less delay and being able to continually go a direction much quicker. A buffer might have to be implemented and possibly communication back to the program for this to function.

backlog-item.name: Software Immediate Halt/Stop - NICE TO HAVE
backlog-item.description: This is for user safetey in that the software can send an immediate stop command to the external controller, it was add to the already existing hardware button and safeties built in, as well as the power button on the wheelchair.

backlog-item.name: Upgrade to Linear Actuators or Better Servos - NICE TO HAVE
backlog-item.description: In efforts to improve the response time for the user, this would upgrade the joystick movement device to operate quicker and be more responsive, as well as more robust.

backlog-item.name: Modify the Joystick Wiring for improved Response Time - NICE TO HAVE
backlog-item.description: This is the ultimate upgrade for the responsiveness to commands for the user, but is more difficult and puts more costly hardware at risk in case of failure. But, the wheelchair could/should respond to commands almost immediately and voltages can be adjusted to possibly utilize very limited turning while moving forward.

backlog-item.name: Update UI to a GUI for better user feedback - NICE TO HAVE
backlog-item.description: In the effort to improve user feedback a gui could be used to help them make the most of the program and commands, however this would be the antithesis to the approach of no computer at all, which seems harder to do with the limitations of the Epoc Emotive device.

project.name: iFactor
project.description: The project mainly focuses on allowing unauthenticated users to report power outage using the location-based capabilities included with smartphones. User interface design for a smartphone application that allows for power outage reporting and potentially prompting the user to further qualify location information. Designing an algorithm that determines the best possible location using either Wi-Fi connection, GPS or cellular radio based service and reporting the outage. This project doesn’t develop any new software for Soft Authentication it just integrates the existing software to location based service being developed.

backlog-item.name: System should alert end user when time to take a spirometer reading
backlog-item.description: Envision a Windows service for this. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/68113/how-to-create-a-windows-service-from-java-app

backlog-item.name: Data Management services for collected data files
backlog-item.description: No matter which way we get data in (web, file system, whatever) to the server, we need to manage what data we have collected so clinicians can construct custom data sets, ensure no redundancy, and correct any perceived errors. I envision something like an iTunes metadata file in a managed directory.

backlog-item.name: Export dataset to Excel
backlog-item.description: When the clinician defines a dataset, we should be able to export it to an analysis tool such as Excel for post-processing

backlog-item.name: Restrict the user interface to only run our application
backlog-item.description: We do not want the tablet being used for games or other activities as it will impact the data collection processes

backlog-item.name: Create a fault/risk analysis
backlog-item.description: We need to define what could go wrong and how the user will need to react

backlog-item.name: Provide a clinician "backdoor" to see configuration, user interaction and data reading information on the tablet
backlog-item.description: We envision the clinician having to go into the home and work with the tablet to extract data, update configuration, troubleshoot, and analyze how the patient is using the application on-site

backlog-item.name: Provide a backdoor interface for parents to update or troubleshoot the application under the clinician's guidance
backlog-item.description: We envision scenarios where it may require a parent to go into a tablet and update a configuration setting (such as calendar reading times) or perform minor troubleshooting, and these should be protected features

backlog-item.name: System should "roll" air quality readings based on configuration parameters
backlog-item.description: The Dylos captures log info every minute, we want to roll the logs periodically. On hold until we better understand their logging requirements

backlog-item.name: Provide contextualized help for patient UI
backlog-item.description: The tablet application should provide rich media and text-based help for every user interaction

backlog-item.name: Create a configuration format and tool
backlog-item.description: The application should allow for configurable parameters whenever possible, including display items (font size, background color/image), nature of alerts (visual, auditory, etc.) and so on. Clinicians should be able to modify parameters upon provisioning and when conducting a site visit

backlog-item.name: Provide visible and intuitive feedback for air quality monitor readings
backlog-item.description: There are open questions around how often the monitor runs and the granularity of data collection that need to be resolved

backlog-item.name: Provide medication reminders
backlog-item.description: The proposal says the app will provide medication reminders but provides no other detail.

backlog-item.name: Track user interactions
backlog-item.description: The proposal states that "clicks" and "uploads" will be counted. From our perspective we should track every interaction we can, including time-on-task.

backlog-item.name: Feedback to the patient and the patient's parent on task progress
backlog-item.description: Provide positive feedback via a metaphor such as a plant growing or a pet being fed or a game with unlocked levels

backlog-item.name: Provide trending information to the household on air quality readings
backlog-item.description: This is distinct from the continuous AQM display, instead we can provide a trending chart to show how AQ is in the home based on a time window

sprint.name: Sprint 1 - Scrum Master: Priscilla Siquieros
sprint.description: Goal: To be able to create an application for android devices that to talk to the service: RideShare. We will structure our group into four layers: Application, Services, Database and UI.

sprint.name: Sprint 2 - Scrum Master: Kellie Watson

backlog-item.name: User can see error messages for failed transactions
backlog-item.description: Currently, when we do a check for somethign the user has done (checking if their username is right or if they've correctly reset their password etc) we use php headers to redirect them, but these provide no messages to the user. We can use URL parameters and different error codes in the parameter to pass error messages using php headers. In our jquery header file we can check if there's a URL parameter for errors available, and if it is we'll decode the error and display the proper message to the user

time-entry.description: Created a PHP script that creates a database and table on localhost. Just need to setup the server to allow me to create a database on it.

created a PHP script that checks to make sure the correct email and pass are in the database to verify the user. I currently have it working on my local server but I haven't uploaded it to the live server yet. I need group permission and approval first.
created a register script that adds users to the database. It also encrypts the users password. I also updated the login script but for some reason its not connecting to the database at the moment.
updated the registration script so blank users are not created. All of the fields on the registration page have to be filled in for a user to be created.

finally finished the login script to check the database and verify that a user is in it and redirect to the mainhub. It also starts a session for the verified user. You can also click on the register button and it will take you to the registration page and add a new user there.

Added the registration and login to the live server but ran into problems. It took awhile but I figure out that the mysql_real_escape_string parts were breaking the php code. both the registration and login work on the live site now.

backlog-item.name: Auto pricing breakdown - wallet transfer
backlog-item.description: When creating the price for the item, we would like to have it auto-populate different percentages that would then be totaled together for a final price. These amounts would then move to their own "wallets" for monitoring and comparison with actuals later. (Tax, shipping, cc fee, processing, round up) For example: Base Price: $20.00 Auto assume: + Shipping & Tax (20%): $4.00 + Credit Card fees (3%): $.60 +Processing fees (15%): $3.00 Total: $27.46 + Round up for (?Insert name later?): $.54 (fund a particular cause wallet) Grand Total: $28.00 This would all happen on the back end, but would show up on the product. Example: http://www.donorschoose.org/project/supplies-needed/1188708/
